item.title: Construction Workers in Singapore
item.description: This was the final paper I wrote for a USP module called Human Trafficking and Labour Migration (UWC2101F) It may not be the best, but I was quite proud of it as it was my first time writing an actual long paper, which I would not have done if not for USP. Construction Workers in Singapore: Their Precarious Situation and Ways to Mitigate It Abstract This paper examines the predicament of construction workers in Singapore, and uses Ruhs and Martinâ€™s paper on the tradeoffs between numbers and rights of workers to explain the minimal rights the workers receive.
